content.description:
This was the line that grabbed me first, though I admittedly have strange taste in boulders. It is low ball and a bit awkward though I think I could make it less so with a few more ascents of it.  

  Sit comfortably under a low roof and stick your arm deep in to the best hand jam in the world. Feet are very tricky so I ended up actually using a figure four kind of move. If you are super strong you might be able to just campus it. From here use some trickery to get to a killer jug and top it out. Climb a short slab and down climb easily.
content.protection: Pad... spotter over a couple of funky rocks if you invert the way i did.
content.location: Lowest point in the cluster of boulders. South facing.

content.description:
Start standing on a rock with both hands on the arete. Find the right tiny feet and pull on. Make a little move to a crimp rail over the lip. and continue up the arete to its top and make a mantle move before running up a short slab to the top. Walk off easily. 

  My favorite part of this one was it's fun footwork. Small face holds and heel and toe hooks with interesting body position. 

  I would give this 4 stars personally if it weren't for one detail. The crimp rail is a little hollow and i needed to break it back a little before i thought it would be solid. Over time we shall see how it holds up and perhaps i will call it classic.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.

content.description:
A really fun moderate climb in a great spot. Easy enough to get to the lip, high enough to be exciting and classic enough to run multiple laps on. 

  Start standing on good hands with not much for feet. A few moves up on more good holds and you will have all the feet you want. The top out is the crux. Classic mantle move. Press it out and walk off. Great stuff.
content.protection: A pad or two. Perfect landing.

content.description:
A short but very fun mantle problem. 

  Start on a crimp rail to the right. pull on with little to no feet. Throw a heel or toe and press it out until you can latch the arete out left and romp to the top.
content.location: To the right of the top of Witchcraft.

content.description:
Sit at a perfect starting hold at the mouth of the cave between the 2 boulders. Climb up and right using fist jams if you want and mantling on to the smaller boulder.  

  If you like fist jamming you will enjoy it. It is short but sweet.
content.location: Climbing out the cave between the boulders toward the Weakened Warrior side.

content.description: A nice cluster of boulders with decent top outs and easy walk offs. Weakened warrior is the best line so far in my opinion but witchcraft and Wizardry are both really fun too.
